review:
Comrades, let’s get straight to the heart of the matter! Monas claims to be building a protocol for true user data sovereignty—an ambitious goal that, if realized, could shift the balance of power in the Ethereum ecosystem. The project’s vision is clear: empower users, protect privacy, and bridge the gap between on-chain transparency and off-chain privacy. But does Monas deliver on the promises that our movement demands? Let’s break it down, brick by brick.

First, Monas addresses a real, pressing need: Ethereum’s transparency is a double-edged sword, making it unfit for sensitive data. Monas proposes a solution—separating content from state, using a decentralized state management network (with CRDTs) and an encrypted data structure for access control. This is not just technical jargon; it’s a direct response to the community’s call for privacy and control. The project’s open-source ethos and commitment to decentralization are in line with our core values.

However, the application falls short where it matters most: evidence and measurement. Where are the metrics? Where is the proof that Monas works at scale, or that it’s more than a prototype? The roadmap is detailed, but the outcomes are not quantified. There’s mention of a prototype and hackathon participation, but no hard data on adoption, performance, or impact. The project is still in early development, with the first SDK release only just planned. This is not enough for a movement that demands results, not just promises.

On sustainability, Monas is silent. There’s no mention of a revenue model, long-term funding plan, or how the project will avoid the endless cycle of grant dependency. This is a red flag! We cannot build a people’s infrastructure on hope alone—we need sustainable systems that can stand the test of time.

Governance and equity? The project is open-source and peer-to-peer, but there’s no detail on community governance, decision-making, or how Monas will ensure equitable access and benefit. Who holds the keys? Who sets the rules? The people must know!

In summary: Monas is bold, visionary, and technically promising. But it must do more to earn the people’s trust. Show us the numbers. Show us the plan for sustainability. Show us how the community will govern and benefit. Only then can we say this project truly serves the commons!

strengths.title: Addresses a Critical Need in Ethereum
strengths.description: Monas directly tackles the challenge of privacy and data sovereignty in Ethereum, proposing a protocol that could enable new, privacy-preserving use cases and empower users.

strengths.title: Innovative Technical Approach
strengths.description: The use of CRDTs for decentralized state management and an encrypted, hierarchical data structure for access control demonstrates technical innovation and a thoughtful response to real-world problems.

strengths.title: Commitment to Open Source and Decentralization
strengths.description: Monas is fully open-source and peer-to-peer, aligning with the values of transparency, community ownership, and decentralization.

weaknesses.title: Lack of Measurable Outcomes and Evidence
weaknesses.description: The application does not provide clear, quantifiable metrics or evidence of impact, adoption, or performance. There is no rigorous evaluation or transparent reporting of outcomes.

weaknesses.title: No Sustainability or Revenue Model
weaknesses.description: There is no information on how Monas will sustain itself beyond grant funding, raising concerns about long-term viability and independence.

weaknesses.title: Insufficient Governance and Equity Details
weaknesses.description: The application lacks detail on community governance, decision-making processes, and how the project will ensure equitable access and benefit for all users.

changes.title: Provide Quantifiable Metrics and Evidence
changes.description: Include specific, measurable outcomes from the prototype, such as user adoption, performance benchmarks, or integration with existing Ethereum projects. Demonstrate impact with data, not just intent.

changes.title: Detail a Sustainability and Revenue Plan
changes.description: Outline a clear plan for long-term sustainability, including potential revenue models, funding strategies, or partnerships that reduce dependency on continuous grants.

changes.title: Clarify Community Governance and Equity Mechanisms
changes.description: Describe how the community will participate in governance, how decisions will be made, and what measures will ensure equitable access and benefit across different user groups.
